author: randyk
msg: use a constant Apache::Build::BUILD_APREXT to signify that a static
aprext lib should be built to provide symbols for APR/APR::* outside
of the mod_perl.so environment. Currently this is only needed for Win32,
but this way makes it easier to arrange to have other platforms build
things in this manner in the future, should the need arise.

author: gozer
msg: Found another place where (discovered on OSX) sockets were assumed
to be non-blocking when they might not be. Fix test breakage by being

author: gozer
msg: apr-dev is saying that APR_STATUS_IS_SUCCESS shouldn't be used and probably
even axed, the only logical test for success is rv == APR_SUCCESS
